edu.gvsu.cis.spacejourney.managers

Class ActiveProjectileManager

  • edu.gvsu.cis.spacejourney.managers.ActiveProjectileManager

  • public class ActiveProjectileManager

    Singleton class that stores and manages information of active projectiles in a pool.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose() 
      static ActiveProjectileManager getInstance()
      Gets the current projectile manager singleton being used.
      void init()
      MUST be called once after the com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage is setup.
      void poll()
      Polls for updates to any pooled projectile. This controls projectiles that need to be removed from the stage, or added to the edu.gvsu.cis.spacejourney.entity.Graveyard.
      void setStage()
      The stage MUST be set in order for the projectile manager to work properly.
      void setWorld()
      The world MUST be set in order for the projectile manager to work properly.
      void spawnLaser()
      Spawns a laser at the desired x and y location. This includes a texture and Box2d body object.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ActiveProjectileManager getInstance()

        Gets the current projectile manager singleton being used.

        Returns:
        edu.gvsu.cis.spacejourney.managers.ActiveProjectileManager singleton.

      • init

        public void init()

        MUST be called once after the com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage is setup.

      • spawnLaser

        public void spawnLaser()

        Spawns a laser at the desired x and y location. This includes a texture and Box2d body object.

      • poll

        public void poll()

        Polls for updates to any pooled projectile. This controls projectiles that need to be removed from the stage, or added to the edu.gvsu.cis.spacejourney.entity.Graveyard.

      • setStage

        public void setStage()

        The stage MUST be set in order for the projectile manager to work properly.

      • setWorld

        public void setWorld()

        The world MUST be set in order for the projectile manager to work properly.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
